translated: The Question about the Variety of Actions

original: “bhante nāgasena, kena kāraṇena manussā na sabbe samakā, aññe appāyukā, aññe dīghāyukā,
analyzed: bhante nāgasena kena kāraṇena manussā na sabbe samakā aññe appāyukā aññe dīgha āyukā
translated: “Revered Nāgasena, for what reason are human beings not all the same, some having short lives, others long lives,

original: aññe bahvābādhā aññe appābādhā, aññe dubbaṇṇā, aññe vaṇṇavanto, aññe appesakkhā,
analyzed: aññe bahu ābādhāḥ aññe appa ābādhāḥ aññe dubbaṇṇāḥ aññe vaṇṇavanto aññe appesakkhāḥ
translated: some being sickly, others healthy, some ugly, others beautiful, some being uninfluential,

original: aññe mahesakkhā, aññe appabhogā, aññe mahābhogā, aññe nīcakulīnā, aññe mahākulīnā,
analyzed: aññe mahesakkhā aññe appabhogāḥ aññe mahābhogāḥ aññe nīca kulīnāḥ aññe mahā kulīnā
translated: others influential, some poor, others rich, some being of low birth, others of high birth,

original: “kissa pana, mahārāja, rukkhā na sabbe samakā, aññe ambilā, aññe lavaṇā, aññe tittakā, aññe kaṭukā, aññe kasāvā, aññe madhurā”ti?
analyzed: kissa pana mahā rāja rukkhāḥ na sabbe samakāḥ aññe ambilāḥ aññe lavaṇāḥ aññe tittakāḥ aññe kaṭukāḥ aññe kasāvāḥ aññe madhurā ati
translated: “But, sire, why are trees not all the same, some being sour, others salty, others bitter, others sharp, others astringent, others sweet?”
“Revered sir, I think it is because of the variety of seeds.”

original: “Evameva kho, mahārāja, kammānaṁ nānākaraṇena manussā na sabbe samakā, aññe appāyukā,
analyzed: evam eva kho mahā rāja kammānam nānākaraṇena manussāḥ na sabbe samakāḥ aññe appāyukā
translated: “Even so, sire, it is because of the variety of kamma that human beings are not all the same, some having short lives,

original: aññe dīghāyukā, aññe bahvābādhā, aññe appābādhā, aññe dubbaṇṇā, aññe vaṇṇavanto,
analyzed: aññe dīgha āyukāḥ aññe bahu ābādhāḥ aññe appa ābādhāḥ aññe dubbaṇṇāḥ aññe vaṇṇavanto
translated: others long lives, some being sickly, others healthy, some ugly, others beautiful,

original: aññe appesakkhā, aññe mahesakkhā, aññe appabhogā, aññe mahābhogā, aññe nīcakulīnā,
analyzed: aññe appesakkhāḥ aññe mahesakkhāḥ aññe appabhogāḥ aññe mahā bhogāḥ aññe nīca kulīnā
translated: some are of little influence, some are of great influence, some have few possessions, some have great possessions, some are of low family,

original: aññe mahākulīnā, aññe duppaññā, aññe paññavanto.
analyzed: aññe mahā kulīnāḥ aññe duppaññāḥ aññe paññavanto
translated: some are of high family, some are of little wisdom, some are of great wisdom.

This was said by the Fortunate One, Great King:🔽‘Beings are owners of their actions, Māṇava, heirs of their actions, they originate from their actions, are bound to their actions, their actions are their friends, their refuge,

original: ‘kammassakā, māṇava, sattā kammadāyādā kammayonī kammabandhū kammappaṭisaraṇā, kammaṁ satte vibhajati yadidaṁ hīnappaṇītatāyā’”ti.
analyzed: kammassakā māṇava sattā kamma dāyādā kamma yonī kamma bandhū kamma ppaṭisaraṇā kammam satte vibhajati yat idam hīna ppaṇīta tāya ati
translated: their place of rest. It is action that distinguishes beings into low and high.’“
